name: A1C
specialInstructions: Puncture the finger with a lancet and obtain "2nd drop" of blood

name: Endocervical Female GC/CT Test
instructions: Show swab package open and swab stick 1/2 exposure

name: Hemoglobin
specialInstructions: Puncture the finger with a lancet and obtain "3rd drop" of blood

name: Male Urethral Swab GC/CT Test
instructions: Show swab package open and swab stick 1/2 exposure

name: PAP - Thin Prep Set
instructions: Container for the thin prep jar
specialInstructions: Instruct patient to undress from waist down and use papoer drape to cover

name: Plantar Wart Tray Set Up
instructions: Sprayer with Liquid Nitrogen filled to 1/4

name: Stool C. diff
instructions: 1 Lab label and a requisition form
1 Spatula or tongue depressor to collect stool
Offer 1 pair of gloves if patiet is without gloves
specialInstructions: Instruct patient to collect about 1/3 of the sterile cup with stool and place in the freezer. Bring the frozen stool cup and the label form to Quest Lab for processing. Remember to remind patient to schedule appointment in advance before dropping off sample at Quest

name: Stool Culture
instructions: 1 Orange Para-Pak CRS bottle. Check for expiration date
1 Lab label and a requisition form
Offer 1 pair of gloves if patiet is without gloves
specialInstructions: Instruct the patient to keep the clear liquid preservative in the bottle. Use small spoon attached to the cap to scoop the stool over the red line of the orange bottle. Store at room temperature. Bring specimen & lab form to Quest Lab for processing. Remember to remind pt to schedule appointment in advance before dropping off sample at Quest

name: Stool O&P
instructions: 3 Black "Total-Fix" O&P bottles. Check for expiration date. Label the top cap of each bottle as 1, 2, and 3 to indicate the day of collection.
3 Lab labels and a requisition form. Make sure the encounter label DOES NOT COVER the "fill" line.
Offer 3 pairs of gloves if patient is without gloves
specialInstructions: Instruct patient to keep the clear liquid of each bottle. Each bottle has a small spoon attached to the lid. Use this spoon to fill the bottle with stool until it reaches the black "fill" line. Collect 1 O&P bottle per day: one for Day1, one for Day 2, and one for Day 3. Store at room temperature After collecting samples for 3 days, bring all the stool specimens and the lab form to Quest Lab for processing.

name: Throat or Rectal GC/CT Test
instructions: Show swab package open and swab stick handle 1/2 exposure
Ensure that each tube is labeled with the appropriate stickers - "Throat" or "Rectal" - if both types of tests are being conducted

name: Urine GC/CT for Quest
instructions: Dirty catch urine(first stream) in Quest cup
Fill the "Apitma Urine Tube" with urine to the level between the fill area window markers

name: ER
subtitle: Instructions for (Taxi) Arrangements to Hospital:
bulletPoints: Double-check with the patient before calling the taxi to ensure they still want it, as plans can change
Confirm the hospital name with the doctor (e.g., "Summit ER Hospital")
Get a taxi voucher form from the nursing room on the 2nd floor, if not 3rd floor. Tear off the first page for the driver after finished filling in and keep the second slip for records
Call a taxi and specify "Summit Hospital" as the destination. If asked about payment, mention it's a taxi voucher. Provide the phone number (510) 318-5800 or clinic address if needed
Ask the PSR to print the face sheet and referral, and I will print the signed progress note (indicated by a check mark) to give to the patient
Inform downstairs PSR and receptionist (extension 5801) about the taxi arriving to pick up the patient
bulletPoints2: Ask the provider the reason the patient is going to the ER
Address: 835 Webster Street Oakland CA 94607, Rolland & Kathryne Lowe Medical Center
Special Equipment: Sometimes they ask if patient needs special equipment, confirm with doctor

name: Glucose
instructions: To perform a glucose test, first prepare your glucose meter and insert a test strip if needed. Clean your finger with an alcohol swab and let it dry. Use a lancing device to prick the side of your fingertip and gently squeeze to obtain a drop of blood. Use the second drop of blood for testing. Apply the second drop to the test strip according to the meterâ€™s instructions and wait for the meter to display your blood glucose level.
supplies: HemoCue Glucose Cuvettes from the Fridge

name: IUD Setup
supplies: Extra Sterile Bag of Cotton Swab
bulletPoints: IUD Sterile Set: Located in the left cabinet on the far side of the utility room
Sterile Field: Central section of the cabinet high above within the utility room
Pad: In the exam room, under the bed where you'll see all the speculums.
Sterile Gauze 2x2: Central section of the back room's far left side
Drape: In the exam room, in one of those cabinets below
Extra Sterile Bag of Cotton Swab: Central section of the utility room where you find all of the procedure tools
Lubricant Jelly: In the exam room, in one of those cabinets above
Povidone/Betadine: In the exam room, in one of those cabinets above
IUD Device: Mirena or Paraguard: Right section of the cabinet within the utility room

name: Knee Injection
instructions: Ensure all items are in the procedure cart. Note that Kenalog-10 and Kenalog-40 are for "ONE-TIME USE ONLY"; discard them after the doctor has finished. For Lidocaine bottles, write the expiration date after opening. Record the open date and the expiration date, which is 28 days later.

name: Staple Removal
instructions: Retrieve a "Skin Staple Remover" from the inventory room for the doctor. Please note that it is for "SINGLE USE ONLY" and should be discarded after the doctor has finished using it.

name: Sputum Instructions
subtitle: Morning Sputum Collection Instructions:
subtitle3: Medical Assistant Guide: Preparing Sputum for Patients
subheading: Grab 3 Specimen Bags: Each bag should contain
bulletPoints: Collect sputum immediately after waking up.
Do not brush your teeth or drink water beforehand.
Ensure sputum (not saliva) reaches the line 5 mark on the tube.
If needed, keep coughing until the mucus reaches the line.
After collecting the mucus, place the sputum sample and the requisition form in the provided bag.
Store the bag in a regular refrigerator.
bulletPoints2: Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday (Drop off on Tuesday at clinic)
Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday (Drop off on Thursday at clinic)
bulletPoints3: A completed public health form signed by the doctor (Total 3 copies)
Label each bag with the numbers 1, 2, and 3, as well as the collection date.
Mark the tube with a yellow highlighter for the patient to write the date of the sputum sample.
bulletPoints4: Include the patient's first and last name
bulletPoints5: Place a copy of the public health form in the medical records box for scanning
